Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Literary papyrus
Description: On the link between papyrus P. Lille 70 (e) and P. Lille 70 (c), see the relevant entries. This is the longest and most important papyrus in the entire P. Lille 70 (a-f) series. Probable mentions of Themistokles (column I, line 3), Perikles (column I, line 8), Aristide (column I, line 15) Asklepios (column II, line 2), Miltiade (column II, line 3), which confirm that this text contains a numbre of historical allusions.
